physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild erythema over the cheeks, slight erythema over left lower leg swelling, no hyperpigmentation, tethering of the skin to the underlying fascia, peau d'orange change, or hair loss. Full motion of all joints without inflammation or deformity.

Pitting edema (1+) of the left leg, bluish discoloration of the skin, normal peripheral pulses, left calf circumference 35 cm, right calf circumference 32 cm. Noninvasive vascular studies showed no evidence of deep venous thrombosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Swelling of the left leg persisted.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild edema from the left ankle to mid-thigh, erythematous discoloration of the skin in a reticular pattern, atrophie blanche.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Swelling of the left leg and reticular erythema of the skin persisted.

physical_examinations.date: 7 months before evaluation at this hospital
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Diffuse erythema and thickening of the skin of the left leg from lower calf to thigh, thickened skin of the right calf without erythema. Hematocrit was 34%; complete blood count normal, no abnormalities.

Induration of the left leg extending to mid-thigh, prominent telangiectasias over the cheeks. Hyperpigmentation of the skin of the left thigh, both lower legs, and left forearm. Tethering of skin to the underlying fascia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Skin changes progressed with worsening symptoms.
